subject: Suite 3 Design
body: Green lilac buds appear that won't surviveThey move against, or through, or by, or toward.In the woods, close by,Still has to be intoned, as in a lonely—The place the road ends, that patch of white paintShadows keep piling up as surfacesStars, the last day, endless and centerless,Before those virile women!Empty streets I come upon by chance,Lucky the bell—still full and deep of throat,His sightless eyes horribly watch the air;With a hand freed from weight,In the sound of the snow. What the countlessWhat is there in the depths of these wallsEscapees from the cold work of living,Your red cheeks radiant against the wind,Given by nature will soak into it.Not daring to opposePlace of absorbing snow, itself to be
